I'm guessing we are using the guard condition in this case since we are performing string concatenation.
No need to change right now but the following approach would allow us to get rid of the "if" block.
Since we are using slf4j we can get rid of the guard condition by using

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            logger.debug("Getting file: " + srcFile);
          
          
            
                            logger.debug("Getting file: {}",  srcFile);
          
      
    
    
  

This gets rid of the superfluous string concatenation when the logger is disabled for DEBUG level.

There are a lot of little things like that to clean up - I'm just changing the logging from info to debug here, since the info logging was cluttering up logging in a test. And this doesn't seem like it warrants "info" level.
